DERBY-6516 Convert lang/nestedCommit.sql to JUnit NestedCommitTest

Patch derby-6515 converts the test in question to JUnit and wires it
into the lang suite while removing it from the harness tests.

We have sometimes an error after the conversion, e.g. cf. here:
http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5589368/javadb-task-3833992.html

    java.sql.SQLException: The exception 'java.sql.SQLException: Invalid transaction state - held cursor requires same isolation level' was thrown while evaluating an expression.

	at org.apache.derby.client.am.ClientStatement.completeExecute(ClientStatement.java:1861)

Caused by: ERROR X0X03: Invalid transaction state - held cursor requires same isolation level

The code that fails here is in GenericLanguageConnectionContext#setIsolationLevel:

setIsolationLevel
if (!verifyAllHeldResultSetsAreClosed())
{
    throw StandardException.newException(SQLState.LANG_CANT_CHANGE_ISOLATION_HOLD_CURSOR
}

and the method "verifyAllHeldResultSetsAreClosed" does explicit garbage collection:

verifyAllHeldResultSetsAreClosed
:
        // There may be open ResultSet's that are yet to be garbage collected
        // let's try and force these out rather than throw an error
        System.gc();
        System.runFinalization();
:

so it seems this is consistent with what we are seeing: intermittent errors.

Attaching a patch to retry the failing statement after sleep and explicit garbage collection. We try retry max 5 times. I'm not sure if this will help,
we'll see when the test result come in...

It reproduces reliably in my environment when I run the test with -XX:+DisableExplicitGC. (Haven't tested with the patch, but I suppose the extra explicit garbage collection won't help if explicit gc is disabled.)

Uploading a second patch (derby-6516-gc) for the intermittent test, which explicitly closes the lingering result set. From the commit message:

DERBY-5616 Convert lang/nestedCommit.sql to JUnit NestedCommitTest

Patch to fix the intermittent error we saw on this issue. The patch
makes sure we close the result set for the statement 'values
doConnCommitInt()' when executed inside a stored
procedure. Previously, it was executed by the stored procedure
"doConnStmtIntNoRS". We changed that to "doConnStmtInt" since this
statement does indeed have a result set.

The supporting procedure in Triggers#doConnStmt also had to be fixed a
bit, since this particular result set closes itself by performing a
commit inside the store procedure, which led the second ResultSet#next
to throw XLC16.

With the patch, I do not see the original error even when disabling the
explicit garbage collection (Java option -XX:+DisableExplicitGC).

Thanks for the hint about turning off the automatic gc, Knut. That made it quick to find the offending result set.
Running regressions. [Update: passed modulo lucene errors]
